info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 20 at 1:54PM CST until November 21 at 8:30PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in San Angelo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
San Saba River Near Brady affecting McCulloch County.
For the San Saba River...including Brady, Menard, San Saba... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Saba River near Brady.
* WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow evening.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 2.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 20.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 11/03/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 700 AM CST.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING
